wrapper.datastructures

Class DataStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapper.AnnotatedVariable
      • wrapper.datastructures.DataStructure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Array, IndependentElement

    public abstract class DataStructure
extends AnnotatedVariable
    A data structure for use in visualisation.
    Author:
    Richard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getElements

        public abstract java.util.List<Element> getElements()
        Returns the list of elements held by this DataStructure. Used when drawing the elements.
        Returns:
        The list of elements held by this DataStructure.

      • size

        public abstract int size()
        Returns the number of elements held by this DataStructure.
        Returns:
        The number of elements held by this DataStructure.

      • clear

        public abstract void clear()
        Clear all set values in the structure

      • applyOperation

        public abstract void applyOperation(Operation op)
        Apply an operation to the structure
        Parameters:
        op - to be applied

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getRawVisual

        public abstract java.lang.String getRawVisual()
        Returns the default raw visual for this DataStructure.
        NOTE: Must never return null! Use return ""; instead.
        Returns:
        The default raw visual for this DataStructure.

      • getAbstractVisual

        public abstract java.lang.String getAbstractVisual()
        Returns the default visual for the raw type held by this DataStructure.
        NOTE: Must never return null! Use return ""; instead.
        Returns:
        A visual style if available, null otherwise.

      • getModifiedElements

        public java.util.List<Element> getModifiedElements()
        A list of elements which have been modified. They should be drawn with a different colour. All elements which were in the list when this method is called are copied to the list returned by getResetElements. The list should be cleared manually once drawing is done.
        Returns:
        A list of elements which have been modified.

      • getResetElements

        public java.util.List<Element> getResetElements()
        A list of elements which were modified but have already been drawn as such. Their colours should be reset. As the list is never cleared, it should be done manually once elements have been drawn.
        Returns:
        A list of elements whose colour should be reset.

      • clearElementLists

        public void clearElementLists()
        Clear modifierElements() and resetElements() lists.

      • elementsDrawn

        public void elementsDrawn()
        Indicate to the DataStructure that the lists returned by getModifiedElements() and getResetElements have been drawn.
